author: cmpilato

Found by: Leo Katzenstein <lrk{_AT_}google.com>
Patch by: kfogel

author: pburba
msg: Fix last outstanding portion of issue #2829 "Improve handling for skipped
paths encountered during a merge"
Specifically this addresses the problem where a merge adds a path, but that
path's immediate parent has non-inheritable mergeinfo due to path having
missing siblings (or from an earlier shallow merge).  Previously the added
path would get no explicit mergeinfo for the merge and incorrectly inherit
mergeinfo from its parent (if any ranges were actually inheritable) or just
have the incomplete explicit mergeinfo from the merge source if any existed.
Now the path always gets explicit mergeinfo, a combination of any explict
mergeinfo it had from the merge source and the mergeinfo describing the merge
that added it.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(notification_receiver_baton_t): Add member 'added_paths'.
(notification_receiver): Store the root path of any added subtree in the
new 'added_paths' member of notification_receiver_baton_t.
(do_directory_merge): Add explicit mergeinfo describing the merge to the
root of added subtrees which have parents with non-inheritable mergeinfo.
(do_merge): Initialize new 'added_paths' member.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_authz_tests.py
(mergeinfo_and_skipped_paths): Expand test to cover case where added path
has missing sibling.

author: glasser
msg: In already-bumped FSFS version 3, store the protorev and its lock
separately from the rest of the transaction metadata, to make it easy
for administrators to put the non-protorev metadata on a different
filesystem from the immutable filesystem data.  (That is, if you can
guarantee that any transaction is only used by one frontend server,
and your repository is on a network filesystem, you can make
transactions/ be a symlink to local disk but leave the protorev
on the network filesystem.)
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/fs.h
(PATH_TXN_PROTOS_DIR, PATH_EXT_REV, PATH_EXT_REV_LOCK): New.
(PATH_REV, PATH_REV_LOCK): Move later and document as legacy.
(SVN_FS_FS__MIN_PROTOREVS_DIR_FORMAT): New.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/fs_fs.c
(path_txn_proto_rev, path_txn_proto_rev_lock): Return the new path
if the format is new enough.
(svn_fs_fs__hotcopy): Make an empty txn-protorevs directory if the
format supports it.
(svn_fs_fs__purge_txn): If the format is new enough, try to delete
the protorev file and its lock after removing the txn directory.
(svn_fs_fs__create): If the format is new enough, create
txn-protorevs directory.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/structure
(Layout of the FS directory): Document txn-protorevs.
(Filesystem formats): Document difference between versions.
(Transaction layout): Document difference between versions.
